hero.title: AI for your body. Built for real progress.
hero.subtitle: Transform your fitness journey with intelligent, personalized guidance that adapts to your body, goals, and lifestyle. Experience long-term results through data-driven insights and consistent support.

genericPlans.description: One-size-fits-all programs that ignore your unique body and goals

inconsistentTracking.description: Losing momentum without clear metrics and accountability

motivationFades.title: Motivation Fades
motivationFades.description: Initial enthusiasm wanes without structured support and progress visibility

gamifiedConsistency.title: Gamified Consistency
gamifiedConsistency.description: XP, streaks, badges, and levels that make progress engaging and sustainable

features.title: Built as one intelligent system
features.subtitle: Every feature works together to support long-term progress.

aiCoach.title: AI Coach
aiCoach.value: Intelligent guidance that adapts to your progress.
aiCoach.description: Receive personalized recommendations and insights that evolve with your fitness journey, ensuring your plan stays aligned with your changing needs.

mealPlanner.title: AI Meal Planner
mealPlanner.value: Nutritional precision tailored to your body composition.
mealPlanner.description: Meal plans generated from your metrics and goals, with automatic macro calculations and grocery lists that simplify meal preparation.

benefits.macro: Macro targets aligned with your goals

bodyMetrics.title: Body Metrics
bodyMetrics.value: Comprehensive tracking that reveals meaningful trends.
bodyMetrics.description: Monitor body composition, nutritional targets, and progress indicators with analytics that highlight what matters for your specific objectives.

gamification.title: Gamification
gamification.description: Progress tracking through levels, streaks, and achievements designed to maintain momentum and build lasting fitness habits.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.subtitle: Get started in three simple steps

step1.title: Create Profile
step1.description: Share your body metrics, fitness goals, and preferences. Our AI analyzes your unique profile to build a personalized foundation.

step2.title: AI Analyzes Your Body
step2.description: Advanced algorithms process your data to generate custom meal plans, workout recommendations, and nutritional targets.

step3.title: Track Progress & Stay Consistent
step3.description: Monitor your journey with real-time metrics, earn rewards through gamification, and maintain momentum with AI-powered support.

vision.title: Consistency Over Motivation
vision.text1: True transformation doesn't come from bursts of inspiration‚Äîit comes from daily commitment. AI Fitness is designed to be your long-term partner, providing the structure, insights, and encouragement you need to build sustainable habits.
vision.text2: Our AI learns from your progress, adapts to your lifestyle, and helps you stay accountable even when motivation wanes. This isn't a quick fix. It's a system built for real, lasting change.

cta.title: Start your AI fitness journey
cta.subtitle: Join thousands building sustainable fitness habits with intelligent guidance

aiCoach.title: AI Coach
aiCoach.subtitle: Chat with your personal AI fitness coach

suggestions.title: Need ideas? These prompts use keywords the coach understands best:

workout.label: 7-day gym workout plan
workout.keywords: Keywords: workout plan, push pull legs, strength
workout.prompt: Create a 7-day gym workout plan using push/pull/legs split. I can train 5 times per week and I have access to a full gym.

nutrition.label: Daily calorie & macro target
nutrition.prompt: How many calories and macros should I eat to lose fat slowly? I weigh 78 kg, train 4x/week, and want a high-protein target.

recovery.label: Sleep & recovery routine
recovery.prompt: Suggest a recovery plan to improve sleep quality and reduce soreness after heavy leg days.

meal.label: Tomorrow's meal ideas
meal.keywords: Keywords: meal plan, breakfast lunch dinner
meal.prompt: Give me healthy meal ideas for tomorrow that match a low-carb preference and include protein with every meal.

app.label: How to use the app
app.keywords: Keywords: generate meal plan, update profile, grocery list
app.prompt: How do I generate a weekly meal plan, view the grocery list, and update my profile information in the app?

cardio.label: Cardio mix for endurance
cardio.prompt: Plan three cardio sessions this week‚Äîtwo HIIT interval workouts and one steady-state ride‚Äîto improve endurance without losing muscle.

mobility.label: Mobility for tight hips & back
mobility.prompt: Give me a 15-minute mobility routine that opens my hips and eases lower-back tightness on rest days.

plateau.label: Break a fat-loss plateau
plateau.keywords: Keywords: plateau, adjust macros, training tweaks
plateau.prompt: I'm stuck at the same weight for 3 weeks. How should I adjust training and macros to restart fat loss while keeping strength?

habit.label: Consistency & routine help
habit.prompt: Suggest a simple morning and evening routine that keeps me consistent with workouts, logging daily check-ins, and recovery.

mealPrep.label: Sunday meal prep + grocery list
mealPrep.keywords: Keywords: meal prep, grocery list, batch cook
mealPrep.prompt: Outline a Sunday meal-prep plan with 3 protein-rich recipes and the grocery list so I can eat 150g of protein/day.

progress.label: Weekly progress review
progress.prompt: Look at my latest weekly progress entry and tell me what to focus on next week to stay on track with recomposition.

healthRecommendations.whrExplanation: WHR measures fat distribution ‚Äî whether someone stores more fat around the abdomen (visceral fat) or the hips/thighs (subcutaneous fat). Visceral fat (around the waist) is more dangerous because it surrounds internal organs and raises the risk of:
healthRecommendations.whrAtRiskMale: Your WHR is above 0.9, which means you are at risk of those problems above.
healthRecommendations.whrAtRiskFemale: Your WHR is above 0.85, which means you are at risk of those problems above.
healthRecommendations.whrGoodMale: Your WHR is below 0.9, which means you are in a good condition.
healthRecommendations.whrGoodFemale: Your WHR is below 0.85, which means you are in a good condition.
healthRecommendations.heartDiseaseContent: Maintaining a healthy waist-to-hip ratio is important for cardiovascular health. Abdominal obesity is a major risk factor for heart disease, stroke, and type 2 diabetes. Regular exercise, especially cardiovascular activities like walking, running, cycling, or swimming, can help reduce abdominal fat and improve heart health. Aim for at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise per week.
healthRecommendations.sedentaryContent: Starting from a sedentary lifestyle, begin with light activities such as walking for 20-30 minutes daily, gentle stretching, or light yoga. Gradually increase duration and intensity over time. Even small increases in daily activity can significantly improve your health and metabolism.
healthRecommendations.lightlyActiveContent: You're already doing light exercise 1-3 times per week. To progress, add one more session per week or increase the duration of existing workouts. Consider mixing in strength training twice a week to build muscle and boost metabolism.
healthRecommendations.moderatelyActiveContent: You're exercising 3-5 times per week, which is excellent! To maximize results, focus on workout quality and variety. Include both cardiovascular and strength training, and ensure adequate rest days for recovery.
healthRecommendations.veryActiveContent: You're exercising 6-7 times per week - impressive dedication! At this level, focus on workout periodization, proper nutrition, and recovery. Consider varying intensities and incorporating active recovery to prevent overtraining.
healthRecommendations.extraActiveContent: You're training twice daily - excellent commitment! Ensure you're prioritizing recovery, nutrition, and sleep. Periodize your training with varying intensities and include active recovery sessions to maintain performance.
healthRecommendations.loseWeightContent: The information below is suggested for your selected goal! For weight loss, maintain a moderate calorie deficit. Prioritize protein intake to preserve muscle mass during weight loss. Combine resistance training with cardiovascular exercise. Focus on whole foods, minimize processed foods, and stay hydrated.
healthRecommendations.maintainWeightContent: The information below is suggested for your selected goal! To maintain your current weight, eat at your TDEE (Total Daily Energy Expenditure). Focus on balanced nutrition with adequate protein, healthy fats, and complex carbohydrates. Continue regular exercise to maintain muscle mass and metabolism.
healthRecommendations.gainMuscleContent: The information below is suggested for your selected goal! To gain muscle, eat in a slight calorie surplus with adequate protein. Prioritize progressive overload in strength training - gradually increase weight, reps, or sets over time. Focus on compound exercises and ensure sufficient rest and recovery.
healthRecommendations.bodyRecompContent: The information below is suggested for your selected goal! Body recomposition (losing fat while gaining muscle) requires precise nutrition and training. Eat at maintenance calories or slight surplus, with high protein intake. Combine heavy strength training with moderate cardio.

1: Prioritize protein (2g per kg body weight)
Track food intake and stay consistent
2: Monitor weight weekly and adjust if needed
4: Eat at maintenance or slight surplus

healthTips.underweightTip: Consider a gradual weight gain plan with nutrient-dense foods and strength training.
healthTips.overweightTip: Focus on creating a sustainable calorie deficit through balanced diet and regular exercise.
healthTips.normalWeightTip: Maintain your healthy weight with consistent nutrition and regular physical activity.
healthTips.whrAtRiskTip: Consider reducing waist circumference through cardiovascular exercise and a balanced diet.
healthTips.whrGoodTip: Your waist-to-hip ratio indicates good health. Keep up the great work!
healthTips.calorieDeficitTip: You're in a calorie deficit. Ensure adequate protein intake to preserve muscle mass.
healthTips.calorieSurplusTip: You're in a calorie surplus. Focus on nutrient-dense foods and strength training.
healthTips.calorieBalancedTip: Your calorie target aligns with your TDEE. Maintain this balance for steady progress.
healthTips.proteinTip: Aim to consume {{protein}}g of protein daily to support your fitness goals.
healthTips.defaultTip: Stay consistent with your nutrition and exercise plan!

appPage.title: AI Fitness
appPage.mainAppDescription: This is the main application page. Here you'll find all the features from your original Java program:
appPage.profileOverviewDescription: View your complete fitness profile including personal information, body measurements, and calculated metrics.
appPage.bodyMetricsDescription: See your BMI, WHR, WHtR, Body Fat percentage with health interpretations and risk assessments.
appPage.nutritionCalculatorDescription: Get personalized daily calorie goals, macronutrients (protein, fat, carbs), and micronutrient requirements based on your goals.
appPage.profileSettingsDescription: Update your profile information, body measurements, activity level, and fitness goals. All metrics will be automatically recalculated.
